info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 6:25AM MST until July 16 at 9:30AM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, northeastern Pima.
* WHEN...Until 930 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tucson, Oro Valley, Casas Adobes, Tanque Verde, Saguaro National Park East, Sabino Canyon Recreation Area, Catalina Foothills, Mescal and Seven Falls. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM MST THIS MORNING
